sentence.Network_en: In her late sixties she traveled over Europe with a crony of equal years.
sentence.Network_cn: 在接近古稀之年,她同一个与她同年的密友漫游欧洲.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (originally Cambridge university slang): from Greek khronios 'long-lasting' (here used to mean 'contemporary'), from khronos 'time'. Compare with chum

entry.tran: 好友;密友;(尤指)狐朋狗友
entry.def: You can refer to friends that someone spends a lot of time with as their cronies, especially when you disapprove of them.

example.ex: He returned from a lunchtime drinking session with his business cronies.
example.tran: 中午跟那帮生意上的朋友喝完酒后，他回来了。

means.word_mean: 1. a close friend who accompanies his buddies in their activities
